name: Babel no T?
description:
Babel no T? (Tower of Babel) is a platform puzzle game in which the player controls Indiana Borgnine, an archaeologist in search of the air gardens of Babylon. The only path to the gardens lies through the intimidating sixty-four floors of the famous Tower of Babel.

The hero must escape the various rooms of the biblical structure while collecting treasure. Each room is a separate puzzle, where the main objective is to pick up and stack L-shaped building blocks to construct stairs or bridges and reach the exit door. In each of these rooms, the player has a limited number of times that they can pick up these building blocks. The player must also avoid touching roaming enemies like flying bats, golems and the priest guards. When the explorer gets stuck or the level is made unsolvable by a series of wrong actions, a button can be used to kill the main character and reset the room.

shot.caption: Hey, I'm not ready for this...
First level. Looks pretty simple, eh?
My life finally has sense ever since I've discovered the joy of building stairs out of L-shaped blocks
Why would you haunt a tower that doesn't even have a staircase system?
You know, that's what I like - let's just be straightforward, honest with each other
This level looks totally different for some reason. And where are the blocks?..
You know, that has always been your problem - you must be on top of everything
As Indiana's life flashes before his eyes, he realizes - perhaps with tardiness - that taking an active part in a 8-bit puzzle game may have not been the best decision of his life
Great, I see I've got help!
